alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 1:32AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marshall County through 215 AM CDT... At 132 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Albertville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albertville, Boaz, Douglas, McVille, High Point, Horton and Rabbit Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
